DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Laparoscopic Port Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the numeric unique identifier of the medical appliance inserted into an incision for laparoscopic examination that allows other laparoscopy devices to pass through the skin and into the abdominal cavity.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the unique identifier of the medical appliance inserted into an incision for laparoscopic examination that allows other laparoscopy devices to pass through the skin and into the abdominal cavity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: A medical appliance inserted into an incision for laparoscopic examination that provides a pathway for allows other laparoscopy devices to pass through the skin and into the abdominal cavity.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A medical appliance inserted into an incision for laparoscopic examination that provides a pathway for allows other laparoscopy devices to pass through the skin and into the abdominal cavity.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numeral used to identify the laparoscopic port.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
